instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery, where to buy??
threads.message:
having lot of <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid spilled machines every month, 2015 models.
as we all know,without a good battery, the board won't power on for this 2015 model. questions is where do you guys this 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> models battery??

ebay is selling around 80, quite expensive,not the biggest issue,thing is that, they always give you bad shit, always are service batteries ,can't be charged, all that kind of stuffs.customers waited for a week for that and in the end have to order again and hope another work.

any good place to order? or sellers?
thank you

threads.title: 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery, where to buy??
threads.message:
Mine come from Ebay, there is just no source of "perfect" batteries. It is all pulled junk from China and you have to live with that.

Also these boards power up fine without battery, may have shut down issues but it should power up.

threads.title: 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery, where to buy??
threads.message: Hey duke,are you sure?  board number <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, they really don't power up when it disconnect the batteries, every machine I saw here. must connect then it will power up.it's 2015 model

threads.title: 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery, where to buy??
threads.message: Power up just fine here.....using 60/85W charger?

threads.title: 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery, where to buy??
threads.message:
yes tried both already , maybe different bios?

it's the same for 2015 air as well
